content.description:
Not often generous in amber coloured ice but the odd year,this pillar will touch ground and offer a very exciting climbing experience. If shy and hanging,you can still have a shot at it by throwing in a few mixed moves from the right. 50 meters right of main cascade
You will find many trees on top to get yourself back on deck. Std screw rack
Small rock gear rack(if just hanging)

This is the main ice cliff, pick your line and have fun!

Ice rack, slings and rap rings if no-one has set-up the raps.

Climbing at Du Rocher is not as attractive as Shawbridge or Vache Noire but by its orientation, it will always offer you well hydrated and thick ice all the way to april.

You will find interesting lines in the WI3+ to WI4+ range and a potential for a few moderate to harder mixed routes as well.

The main cascade usually offers a steeper start (15m) that eases off through low angle snow/crust then approx.15 more meters of easy ice (WI3) giving +/- 40 meters total.

Always worth the visit especially if you want to avoid crowds and sun baked ice!!!

Approach:

From cul-de-sac (u-turn), take the wide trail that goes to the right. This is the access for many residents and cottage folks, be respectful since they allow us to use this path.

Walk +/- 250m and carefully watch for an orange flag marking the final approach on the left.

You should from that point(in front of a white/gray house),have a glimpse of the icefall.

Follow flagged trail for 5 minutes.
